title: Aiko Melendez
text:
Aiko Melendez (born December 16, 1975) is a <a href="Filipinos">Filipina</a> actress and former politician. Her father, Jimmy Melendez (born Jim Shinoji), was an actor. Her half-brother, Jam Melendez (son of Jimmy Melendez and Deborah Sun), also entered showbusiness.
Aiko Melendez started as child star in the early '80s under Regal Films among them, "Santa Claus is Coming to Town" in 1982 and she was billed simply as Aiko. In the late '80s, the same movie outfit, launched her together with <a href="Ruffa%20Gutierrez">Ruffa Gutierrez</a> and <a href="Carmina%20Villaroel">Carmina Villaroel</a> as teen actresses. From the late '80s through '90s, she became a blockbuster leading lady to big actors such as <a href="Richard%20Gomez">Richard Gomez</a>, <a href="Jomari%20Yllana">Jomari Yllana</a> and <a href="Aga%20Muhlach">Aga Muhlach</a>. She received multiple awards for "May Minamahal" in 1993 and "Sa 'yo Lamang" in 1995. Her 1997 film, "Kahit Kailan", received several awards at the <a href="Metro%20Manila%20Film%20Festival">Metro Manila Film Festival</a> (MMFF). The movie was produced by <a href="Lily%20Monteverde">Lily Monteverde</a>. In the late 2000s, she starred in TV shows. In 2017, she garnered praises for her work in "<a href="Wildflower%20%28TV%20series%29">Wildflower</a>", a primetime soap opera.
Career.
Melendez was discovered in the late 1980s and signed a contract with <a href="Regal%20Films">Regal Films</a>, becoming one of their 'Regal Babies'.
In 2001, Aiko ran for councilor in the <a href="city">city</a> elections in <a href="Quezon%20City">Quezon City</a> and won. She became Councilor of the 2nd District of <a href="Quezon%20City">Quezon City</a> and remained in office for 9 years until 2010. She did several shows on <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA Network</a> but most often appeared on <a href="ABS-CBN%20Corporation">ABS-CBN</a>.
In 2011, Aiko returned to ABS-CBN for an episode of "<a href="Maalaala%20Mo%20Kaya">Maalaala Mo Kaya</a>" and "<a href="Reputasyon">Reputasyon</a>" with <a href="Cristine%20Reyes">Cristine Reyes</a> and <a href="Rayver%20Cruz">Rayver Cruz</a>.
In 2013, she was part of the TV series "<a href="Apoy%20Sa%20Dagat">Apoy Sa Dagat</a>" costarring <a href="Angelica%20Panganiban">Angelica Panganiban</a>, <a href="Piolo%20Pascual">Piolo Pascual</a> and <a href="Diether%20Ocampo">Diether Ocampo</a>.
In 2015, Melendez played the role of Fionna Vargas in "<a href="Inday%20Bote">Inday Bote</a>".
In 2017, Melendez played the role of Emilia Ardiente in Wildflower.
In 2018, Melendez played the role of Matadora/Bighani in Bagani.
In 2019, Melendez returned to <a href="GMA%20Network">GMA Network</a> to play a role in "<a href="Prima%20Donnas">Prima Donnas</a>".
Personal life.
She was married to actor <a href="Jomari%20Yllana">Jomari Yllana</a> from 2000 to 2003. Melendez and Yllana have a son named Andrei.
In 2006, Aiko married Martin Jickain.
In 2013, Aiko converted to <a href="Born%20Again%20Christian">Born Again Christian</a>ity.
